thread.title: Price of Mr Kipling cake boxes to go up as Premier Foods announces it is decreasing the size
thread.title_full: Price of Mr Kipling cake boxes to go up as Premier Foods announces it is decreasing the size

author: Jessica Haworth
title: Price of Mr Kipling cake boxes to go up as Premier Foods announces it is decreasing the size
text:
News Price of Mr Kipling cake boxes to go up as Premier Foods announces it is decreasing the size The cost of other products including Bisto gravy, Oxo cubes, Cadbury cakes and Angel Delight will also increase in the move Share Premier Foods is increasing the cost of some supermarket favourites (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Mr Kipling cake boxes are being cut down in size as the company announces it will be putting prices up this year. 
Premier Foods confirmed it will be increasing the price of the cakes by at least 'single digits'. 
It will also raise the cost of other products, including Bisto gravy and Oxo cubes. 
And boxes of the individually wrapped cakes will be decreased in size - cutting down from nine portions to eight. 
The company told the Sun that it will also get rid of its four cake boxes. 
Affected flavours will be chocolate, angel, lemon and caramel slices, Premier Foods confirmed. Mr Kipling Chocolate Slices will go up in price - and decrease in size (Photo: Ocado) 
Five per cent rise in household bills could push a QUARTER of us into debt 
The new sizes are supposed to be introduced in February, but the company said it accidentally shipped some of the smaller products to Tesco. 
One shopper at a store in Essex told the Sun they noticed the scaled down boxes at a store today. 
A spokesman claimed it was a "genuine error" and apologised for "misleading" customers. Mr Kipling vinnese whirls 
He added: "We take a blended approach to managing cost increases driven by currency and commodity factors. Read More 
"We look to manage our own efficiencies, adjust promotional mechanics and formats where appropriate and finally look at limited price increases where these canâ€™t be avoided. 
"However, on average we are considering rises around the mid single digit mark." Like us on Facebook
